result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-21-2022

Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Eddie Charles Epps.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reinstates justice point supervision LEVEL 4. No contact orders and all other conditions of bond remain. Court orders defendant to go to justice point following court. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Eddie Charles Epps not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Case was misstabbed to Branch 45. Defense motion to modify bail. State objects to any modification. Court denies bail motion. Defendant was found incompetent in 20CM1440. Court will adopt findings and suspend proceedings. Court orders defendant   Case in court for competency hearing.  Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Case adjourned in Branch 02.

Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY ZOOM.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Nash.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Petition and Order for funeral pass.

02:53 PM Attorney Travis Schwantes appears on behalf of Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Eddie Charles Epps not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Witness has been on vacation and didn't receive a subpoena. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TB (d.o.b. 6/16/75)

ADDRESS INFO for Eddie Charles Epps

Prior: 3126 North 11th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Eddie Charles Epps in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eddie Charles Epps appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
